name: VRMark - The VR Benchmark
description: Is your phone ready for VR? Find out with VRMark, the virtual reality benchmark.  VRMark is a benchmarking app that helps you test and compare the VR performance of the latest smartphones. Test your phone with two VR benchmarks and three scenes to explore in Experience Mode. VRMark works with Daydream View and Google Cardboard compatible headsets, but a headset is not required to run the tests.   Amber Room benchmark Use the Amber Room benchmark to test and compare the peak performance of current and next-generation smartphones. The Amber Room test is very demanding for first-generation Daydream devices. Dont be surprised if frame rates are low.  Purple Room benchmark Use the Purple Room benchmark to see if your device can run VR content for a longer period without heating up or slowing down. Some phones will get hot when running this test, and their performance may fall as the test runs.  Experience Mode VRMark includes three free-roaming VR experiences with different levels of complexity. Connect a headset and use Experience Mode to see how well your device compensates for missed frames. Experience mode works with Daydream View and Google Cardboard compatible headsets.   More than a score See how well your device handles VR content with detailed performance monitoring charts. Or search, sort, and filter the in-app list to rank and compare the VR performance of the latest devices.   Recommended requirements OS: Android 7.0 or later Memory: 1 GB Processor architecture: ARM API: OpenGL ES 3.1 or OpenGL ES 3.0 with MSAA support  VRMark works with Daydream View and Google Cardboard compatible headsets, but a headset is not required to run the tests.    Licensing This app is for personal, non-commercial use only. VRMark Professional Edition, designed for industry and press use, provides a more comprehensive set of tools for testing the VR capabilities of the latest devices. Please visit https://benchmarks.ul.com/vrmark-android for details.
